Package server.response

The server.response package contains all of the ServerResponses..

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
ServerResponse This interface dictates a correct response from the Server to a Client.
 

Class Summary
AttackResponse Responds to the attack command as input by the user.
CommandsResponse Responds to the "commands" or "help" command.
DropResponse Responds to the drop command as input by the user.
EmoteResponse Responds to the emote command as input by the user.
GetResponse Responds to the get command as issued by the user.
GiveResponse Invokes give command as requested by the user.
InventoryResponse Responds to the inventory command issued by a player.
LookResponse Responds to the look command as issued by the user.
MoveResponse Responds to the move command as input by the user.
OocResponse Responds to the ooc command as directed by the user.
QuitResponse Terminates a ServerThread's connection to a client, usually invoked by the user when he wants to quit.
SayResponse Responds to the say command from the user.
ScoreResponse Responds to the score command as issued by the user.
ShutdownResponse Responds to the shutdown command as directed by the user.
SocialResponse Responds to various social commands, i.e., wink, giggle, etc.
TellResponse Responds to the say command as input by the user.
UnknownResponse The default response to any action that the Server does not recognize.
UseResponse Responds to the use command as input by the user.
WhoResponse Responds to the who command as requested by the user.
 

Package server.response Description

The server.response package contains all of the ServerResponses..
